reviews.review: Great job JJ Abrams. I had low expectations going in here because of the first two movies which I thought were just OK. Many of the things that frustrated me about the first 2 were corrected in this one and I appreciate that. I'm surprised some reviewers are saying this was the worst Star Wars ever, they are dead wrong.
It's epic, a space opera at its finest as it should be.
Absolutely horrendous end to an already terrible sequel trilogy.
All I can say, the movie was awesome and had it's epic moments but also bring Tissues because it's a train full with emotions.

I'm not sure what movie the 'Critics' saw, but it cannot have been the same movie I saw.  I have re-read many of their reviews and have determined that they could quite possibly be trolls trying to elicit a reaction, or, possibly they don't understand the rich legacy of what has come before it.  Quite simply, this was without a doubt my favorite of all of them.  I know, this is a risky thing to say, I get it.  

Don't get me wrong.  On it's own, it is good.  But, as a part of the larger story, it was perfect.  Enjoyable on every level.  I made the mistake of reading some early reviews and waited throughout the movie for those observations to materialize, which they didn't.  Maybe it was good that I wasn't expecting much, because I sat in my seat after the movie reflecting on what I just saw, not shocked, just happy.  It was an intelligent movie with heart and I applaud those that made it.  Maybe there is some truth in the saying "If you can't do it, become a critic".

Excitement, it had it in droves.  Passion, for a Star Wars fan, yes, more than any before it.   Did it answer questions?  Yes.  Did it have action?  Of course, it is a Star Wars movie.  Did it require you to think with some intelligent introspection?  Yes, which is something that has been missing in many current movie formulas.

I won't judge anyone that doesn't get it (yes I will), but I will say that I have every intention of going again.
would only have changed one thing.  Have all passed Jedis shown while Rey was battling emperor

I felt like with each scene I was falling downhill out of control, unable to stop. Everything felt so rushed that none of the big moments had time to breathe and resonate. There were some great points in the movie, but so much of it felt like they just threw together every cool idea they had without developing them and making them work within the story.
Still had some flaws, but it was better than The Last Jedi in every way. I might even see it again.
It was such a fantastic, emotional end to the series. I cried, which Iâ€™ve never done in a Star Wars movie before. The story kept me guessing until the end. I loved it.

Visually stunning but the story line and plot just feels like they hashed every idea together to fill the mistakes of plot holes from previous films. Feels like the film did not have a clear direction.
